When and how to use this form
when we plan to use the work of management’s specialist
Select the appropriate profiling options for the entity.
uestions: Select one option from each of the groups below
*Refers to audits conducted in the US under the auditing standards issued by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants
This form helps us to document the requirements of EY GAM when we use the work of management’s specialist, whether employed by the entity or externally engaged by
The form is divided into three sections:
Evaluate the competence, capabilities and objectivity of management’s specialist
Obtain an understanding of the work of management’s specialist
Evaluate and conclude whether the results of the specialist’s work supports the relevant assertions in the financial statements
Additional procedures to be performed by the specialist for their work to be adequate for our purposes (as necessary)
Completion of this form addresses all or part of the EY Canvas task:
Perform procedures related to management's specialist
We are not expected to have the expertise of a person qualified to practice another profession or occupation (e.g., an ac
When we require such expertise in order to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence, we consider whether to use the work of an appropriate specialist.
When preparing the financial statements, management may use a specialist in a field other than accounting to address some complexity in the entity’s business or to provide knowledge or expertise tha
We determine whether we are able to use the work of that management’s specialist as audit evidence.
If we decide it is necessary to use the work of a management’s specialist, we:
Evaluate whether the specialist has the necessary competence, capabilities and objectivity for our purposes (Part A)
Obtain an understanding of the work of the specialist (Part B)
Evaluate the specialist’s work to determine whether it is appropriate for our purposes (Part C)
As necessary, request the specialist to perform additional procedures

The preparation of management’s supporting documentation is likely to rely on IPE. Information produced by the entity (IPE) is integral to our auditing of controls and performing our substantive audit procedures. The risks related to IPE are defined in the IPE topic and are to be addressed for all IPE used in the execution of this form.
Document where applicable in this form or cross refer to applicable workpapers. Consider using
The first three risks are relevant when the IPE includes information that comes from an entity’s IT application. The fourth and fifth risk
are relevant when EUC tools (e.g., Excel) are used in producing the IPE.
1. Data processed by the IT application from which the IPE is produced is not complete or accurate
2. Data extracted from the IT application into the IPE is not the intended data or is not complete
3. Computations or categorizations performed in the creation of the IPE from the IT application are inaccurate
4. The data output from the IT application to the EUC tool is modified or lost in the transfer
5. Information added or changed (including new computations and categorizations) using the EUC tool is incomplete, inaccurate or inappropriate

We have performed appropriate audit procedures to conclude that the results of the management’s specialist are reasonable in the circumstances and that they support the relevant assertions in the financial statements
After performing the additional procedures in
, we conclude that the work of the management’s specialist is
Document the details below of the effect this will have on our audit strategy, including any additional or alternative procedures required, and on our audit opinion
, if necessary, the effect this will have on our audit strategy, including any additional or alternative procedures required
If, after performing any additional procedures, we are unable to resolve the matter, we obtain the opinion of another specialist, unless it appears that the matter cannot be resolved.
If a matter has not been resolved or if we conclude, after performing additional procedures, that the assertions in the financial statements are not in accordance with
GAAP, we determine the effect on our auditor’s report in accordance with SPECIALIST 2.5.
We sign-off this form, including the above conclusion statement, in EY Canvas to evidence the preparation, review and approval of this form as well as completion of the following EY Canvas task:
Perform procedures related to management's specialist

work that we wish to use is prepared by a team of specialists, we consider the senior members of the team, who are responsible for supervising the team, decision-making and making judgments as the management specialists when completing this form.
Part A: Evaluate the competence, capabilities and objectivity of management
s specialist employed by the entity
Our personal experience with previous work of the specialist
The specialist’s experience and qualifications, including membership of a professional body or industry association, license to practice or other forms of external recognition
Published papers or books written by the specialist
Discussions we have had with the specialist
Discussions with others who are familiar with the specialist’s work
Depending on the nature of the work of management’s specialist, whether to involve an auditor’s specialist

the competence and capabilities of the management’s specialist
Evaluate the objectivity of a management
s specialist employed by the entity
The risk increases that the objectivity

of a management’s specialist will be impaired when the specialist is employed by the entity. We consider who reviews and challenges the specialist’s conclusions, and whether the specialist has appropriate reporting lines within the entity. We also consider the extent of the specialist‘s involvement in the preparation of the financial statements.
Whether the specialist is managed and directed appropriately
Whether the specialist has any duties that may be incompatible and lead to inadequate segregation of duties
work allows him or her to act objectively, without undue pressure to reach particular conclusions
Depending on the nature of the work of management’s specialist, whether to involve an auditor’s specialist
* If we involve an EY internal specialist to help us evaluate the work of the management’s specialist, we complete
Using the work of an EY internal specialist
the objectivity of the management’s specialist
Evaluate the competency and capabilities of management’s external specialist
Our personal experience with previous work of the specialist
The specialist’s experience and qualifications, including membership of a professional body or industry association, license to practice, or other forms of external recognition
Published papers or books written by the specialist
Discussions we have had with the specialist - As we do not have a direct relationship with the specialist, we request that management arrange for the specialist to communicate with us
Discussions with others who are familiar with the specialist’s work
Depending on the nature of the work of management’s specialist, whether to involve an auditor’s specialist
f we involve an EY internal specialist to help us evaluate the work of the management’s specialist, we complete
Using the work of an EY internal specialist
Evaluate the objectivity of management’s external specialist
increases that the objectivity of management’s external specialist will be impaired when the specialist is related in some manner to the entity.
Whether the specialist’s work allows him/her to act objectively, without undue pressure to reach particular conclusions.
Whether the specialist or his/her organization are related in some manner to the entity.

Such relationships include situations in which the specialist is financially dependent on the entity, or the entity has the ability (through ownership, contractual right, family relationship or otherwise) to directly or indirectly control or significantly influence the specialist
Depending on the nature of the work of management’s specialist, whether to involve an auditor’s specialist
* If we involve an EY internal specialist to help us evaluate the work of the management’s specialist, we complete
Using the work of an EY internal specialist
the objectivity of the management’s specialist
Part B: Obtain an understanding of the work of management’s specialist (SPECIALIST 2.2)
Understanding the work of a specialist employed by the entity
The objectives and scope of the specialist's work
How the methods or assumptions used compare with those used in the preceding period
Whether the form and content of the specialist's findings will enable us to evaluate the work of the specialist and conclude on whether the work is adequate for our purpose
The scope of the work may not be documented if the specialist is employed by the entity and therefore we document the results of our inquiries.
Document the results of our inquiries of the specialist and members of the entity’s management in relation to the nature, scope and objectives of the work
Document the processes management has in place to exercise control over the work of the specialist
procedures in place to challenge and review the specialist’s work, such as a review by those charged with governance or by internal auditors with specialized skills.
When the specialist is subject to
technical performance standards or other professional or industry requirements
, document our understanding of these standards/requirements
Understanding the work of management’s external specialist
The objectives and scope of the specialist's work
How the methods or assumptions used compare with those used in the preceding period
Whether the form and content of the specialist's findings will enable us to evaluate the work of the specialist and conclude on whether the work is adequate for our purpose
Read the terms of the engagement between the entity and the specialist to understand the nature, sco
pe and objectives of the work.
Summarize the nature, scope and objectives of the work
Confirm with management that they have agreed with the specialist that we will be using the specialist’s findings as part of our audit of the financial statements
management can influence the work of the specialist
Document the processes management has in place to exercise control over the work of the specialist
This can include procedures in place to challenge and review the specialist’s work, such as a review by those charged with governance or by internal auditors with specialized skills.
When the specialist is subject to
technical performance standards or other professional or industry requirements
, document our understanding of these standards/requirements
and conclude whether the results of the specialist’s work support the relevant assertions in the financial statements
Depending on the nature of the work of management’s specialist, we consider whether to involve an auditor’s specialist to help us evaluate the work.
Document the procedures performed to evaluate the management specialist’s work

Procedures may include inquiries; corroborative procedures (e.g., confirming relevant matters with third parties or examining published data); testing source data or using an auditor’s specialist to assist.
Evaluate the appropriateness of the management’s specialist’s work as audit evidence, considering
Relevance and reasonableness of significant assumptions, methods and models (SPECIALIST 5.1 and SPECIALIST 5.2):
